normal: 1.03x mult, 1.5x cost, 10^((i-1)^2+1) cost
tickspeed prestige: always 10% decrease (so x(1 / 0.9)),
eventually every 100x, maybe every 1000x or 200x at infinity,
the last bit of decrease (from 150 to 100 perhaps) is very slow
infinity prestige: you gain IP equal to 10^(log(money)/log(infinity) - 1)
infinity: 1.3x mult, (2^i)x cost, 10^(i-1)^2 cost (so the first costs only 1)
infinity power multiplies all normal by it^0.1, but that 0.1 is steadily
increased by a repeatable that adds 0.01 to it (starting at 10,
multiplying by 10 each time up to 1e40 (1e5 after that, so ending at 1e290),
buyable 90 times, but this might be far too slow)
also a 2x upgrade

We currently have a serious issue: 1 prestige -> 10 prestige makes the game about 1.2x quicker at 1e80, that is, it's more or less useless.

One solution would be to have a weak upgrade costing prestige.
